one_reviews_text: One of my favourite Virtual Reality pieces to date, I really enjoyed this piece. Great story & the visuals are divine! Great work, highly recommend :)
Wow! Beautiful artstyle and very touching story. It feels like a modern puppet-theater, and it just feels right; VR is indeed not just for gamers...

Beautiful story and animation.  It was really touching and would LOVE to see more of these in VR.  VR is not only the best way of playing games, but also of telling stories like these.  My only issue was the animation would hiccup very subtly every so often.  Maybe it was my antivirus, but I have a good pc setup and can play almost anything without issues.  Just wanted to point it out in case there is something that needs fixing.

This completely ruined traditional tv for me. There are many ways to tell a story.  Books, movies, live plays, etc. This is the BEST way to tell a story. Everything else suddenly feels outdated. Completely immersed , beautiful  art , beautiful story. Not a word is spoken the entire story, yet it still felt very powerful. A lot of heart and dedication went into this. It proves that the future of story telling is going to be incredible. Great job !!! Thanks for the experience !!
I just wanted to pick Alumette up and keep her.  It's amazing to watch her walk around and the detail of the graphics.  Impressive!!!

If this doesn't touch you in any way I woud check for a pulse. If we are good to each other we will see each other again,if you have a good heart you will be rewarded. I just had my wife experience this and she cried like a baby which in turn had my water works going,this is what VR should be about,an immersive heart felt experience.

I absolutely adore this film! Not only were the graphics and presentation flawless, I had to stop and remove the Rift to wipes my eyes. I’ve watched this film several times and have yet to make it through without crying. I love the emotional connection we build with these characters. Please continue to produce great content like this! A++

review_title: PRESSING A TO START DOES NOT WORK?
one_reviews_text: Looks great. You have to hold the A button down for quite a while to get it started :)

I do like playing games on my Rift but my favourite type of entertainment is the narrative/story type experiences , and this beautiful story is the reason why I love VR. I won't go into the story of this gem as others have already mentioned it but if you are looking for a "hair standing up on you arms and neck" emotion reaction then watch this,  I played through a few times and loved it. I really hope more experiences like this come to the rift as I would be at the front of the queue. Congratulations to Penrose studios. Thank you.

A nice , but sad story. Character movement seemed a bit choppy, otherwise
a cool enviroment and graphics.

I wouldn't mind paying money for this type of quality! It was very immersive. It made me unconciously reach out and try to touch the little characters and homes placed around you. You could watch it from far away or get a really close view of the surroundings. It was very dope!!!

The layout of the "stage" for this little play was pure genius. The viewer is standing in the middle of the set, watching the puppet-like characters act out each scene. Most of the action unfolds right in front, but there's just enough going on around you to make the whole thing feel very immersive. This is a wonderful and artistic use of a new medium.
I really love this! The detail is amazing! If you ever plan on updating, I'd like to see a live/interactive mode. I recomended this to all the people I know with VR.

It felt like watching a miniature theatre with claymation characters. The art style was beautiful and the manner in which the story was told worked very well. This also proves that great art does not age, eventhough this is from 2016 don't let that stop you from enjoying it!
But For Now, 5 Stars!

review_title: Can i cry inside Oculus Rift?
one_reviews_text: Allunette made me fell joy about life.

review_title: I can't put it in words.
one_reviews_text: This truly is a masterpiece, from the little details like seeing the characters interact if you stick your head into their boat, to the shockingly depth of the story. All I found myself wanting to do was reach out to these characters, and help, and comfort them. Show joy with them. Great job !
Very nice little movie. Great for first time VR players.

this is a cool and nice little move and nice setting. The only issue im have is.... The movie lags quite a much on a 1060 graphics card, and there is no graphics setting. Howover the head tracking did stil could track fully, so its still watchable. Due lag, im cant give it 5 stars, but the movie its self is cool.
very nice
Definitly made me tear up. By far the best short movie in VR, just amazing
Just amazing!!!!  wonderfull to see it up close, love to see more like this :)
Allumette is an exceptionally beautiful piece of artwork.

Because this was built in an engine and not just a 360 video, it ment you can truly look around and move you head. I wish it was longer, but i teared up definitly. would 10 star if i could. Truly amazing work. Bring us more!
Just wow

A fine experience. Updated my gfx card to 1080ti and now the choppyness is gone. Still think it is possible to remove the problem with better code. Every 4 seconds there is a glitch where ~12 frames are lost with the lower end card...
Does that really happen to her what i think it does at the end ? o_O

review_title: How the eff do you start it?
one_reviews_text: The onscreen instructions say "HOLD A TO START". However, I tried holding the A button on the Xbox controller, as well as the A button on the right touch controller. In fact. I tried EVERY button, trigger, and joystick on the Xbox controller as well as both touch controllers. I even tried clicking the mouse and pressing keys on the keyboard. It appears that NO FORCE ON EARTH is able to start this story! (Meanwhile, I've had no problems whatsoever with anything else I've downloaded for the Rift.)
Great animation
The creators are wonderfully gifted people.
Good story, the future of movies?
Sweet short story. Visually appealing. No real complaints.

A beautiful, sad story about the girl and her mother. Art style is very good, story on the slow side but emotionally investing. My biggest gripe was the performance. On 1070GTX it definitely wasn't smooth and I've never had problems with any other VR app.
Everything seems so small, it adds to the general feeling of cuteness
Absolutely one of the best uses of VR for storytelling. 10/10 would VR again
I totally enjoyed that experiance. Music was spot on, graphics even better.  I enjoyed leaning over and seeing the details up close.
Really the best movie I have watched so far in VR.

Nice little short story in VR. I like how it was done. Its free and worth a download for when you want to watch a little movie for 10 minutes or so in VR. You can see Zelda or James and the giant peach or something being done like this in the future.

Enjoyed this one, but intermittent audio drops and occasional visual hiccups took me out of the experience. Fortunately Allumete was compelling enough that I was able to overlook the performance issues.
Great job, beautiful immersive atmosphere for this short movie

This is a great showcase of what is possible for animated shorts in VR. It is very well done, I thought I was watching stop motion animation come to life. Surreal. Kudos to the filmmaker, I really enjoyed it.
This is a beatiful surreal film about a mother and her daughter. The CGI reminds me of stop-motion.
Sorry but its so extremly boring...

Very sweet and imaginative take on the Little Matchstick Girl. After a couple of experiences now, I think that watching a narrative play out through miniature 3D figures might be my new favorite way to enjoy VR cinema; I find it much more engaging than the first-person view content I've viewed so far. Would definitely like to see more!

It was free, so that is ok. But still.... really boring. I appreciate beautiful tales and nice stories, but there's good and bad ways of telling a story. This one here is an example of bad storytelling. Still.. very beautiful to look at.

This is hands down the best written & directed VR story experience.  Miyubi I would rate higher, only because of the way they managed to put you in the story and add another dimension to VR, but this is definitely a better story.  Warning though, your VR headset may get wet (from your tears). This is must watch if you have VR and it's free.  10/10 

Watch my Let's play here: https://youtu.be/KjzIv6wSprg
Beautiful graphics and musics but boring, too long...
A captivating story and beautiful environments!  Objects like buildings and bridges were so convincing that I had to remind myself that they weren't really there!  Great work!
after update driver and all aplication, this app can start, but no responce against A button.
beautiful
Brilliant experience. More like this.
Great Animation and Story...
Wonderful story, absolutely loved this film, well done!

Sad story, but definitely made in great way. Would be nice if someone made whole series of cartoons, that you can look from every angle and inside. Very cool. How anyone can give it one or two stars? How can they possibly justify it?
A beautiful VR movie. Music is also beautiful and grand.
well done.

It´s so beautiful and immersive. An amazing story and animation. I´d spend easily 2 hours watching this. 
Thanks a lot!

Perfect made , without doubt.
Just 1 thing: implementing the chirping of a grille
to associate night isnt the thing when its obviously winter. I associate with this sound warm, calm nights .....Thats the only thing which irritates me. And, yes,it´s sad.
Moving short film. Open ended, makes great use of the medium.
A cute and unique 3D short.

After a month of playing various titles on RIFT I can say that this experience which I just watched has moved me the most so far. The VR environment lends itself perfectly to the already classic storyline. It's like watching an opera or play from the front row. I really felt something for the characters which is rare for me even in movies. Great use of VR viewing. Incredible environment. Very well directed.
I cried

I made both my parents watch it. My Dad just stood there like a doofus observing it (no matter how persuasively I shoved him in the back :P) but my Mom got the picture and really stuck her face into the action. That's what you have to do - BE the camera for a charming animated film. I appreciated that responsibility, and consider this film for Top-5 of all VR experiences released in 2016. #awesome

review_title: VR: A portal to the soul....
one_reviews_text: VR as a idea is rather simple, but hidden just below the surface is a powerful truth. That truth is there is a new way for us to peer even closer to what makes us human. An exchange and understanding of one another through our experiences, artistry, and imagery. This is infancy; this is singularity.
An amazing example of VR film making. Beautiful art direction, pacing and sense of omniscient passive presence.
Its a sad story. A very sad story.

For the life of me I will never really understand why everyone keeps praising that Henry short. It was unimaginative and had that dreaded stageplay like feeling of a locked down viewport and everything happening somewhere else. Not so with Allumette. Not so at all. Having the story in miniatures floating in the air was nothing short of a stroke of genius! While the stuttering stop-motion-like movements were unexpected I grew to like it quickly. And to be encouraged as a viewer to walk up to the story and inspect the scenery as the narrative unfolds was stroke nr 2. And the best part for me was when I knew the girl was in the airship and I tried putting my head inside it through the wall and found that they had gone all out and animated the action inside the airship as well I felt rewarded for my curiosity again. Hats off to the makers of this experience. You guys and gals really bent the rules in the right way to present the story in VR in a way that benefited from VR.
Fantastic art. Great stage directing. Pure joy! I can't wait for more animations from Penrose.
Interesting, I like it!

As a child, I used to make stop-motion animations with clay models. This brought me right back to those days: the characters are so tangible, like little clay puppets. The scenes are so beautifully composed for VR, allowing you to walk and peek all around them. Very well done.

review_title: It is amazingly visualised and touching
one_reviews_text:
The start screen already gave me a sense of the quality of this short story. The music is emotional and the scenes contain a strong feeling of love and sorrow.
I reccomend to anyone as it is FREE and it is not a demo!

Short but sweet; just sit back and watch the story.
Keep up the good work Penrose!
A short VR film that work like you want it to. The graphism are simple but cute and the story is also simple but poetic. One of the first vr movie I watched that is realy immersive.

Have some tissues handy. Best way I can describe the experience: it's like watching a cross between a play and a puppet show.

Spoiler alert!
This is the most amazing part of the experience... right around the middle of the story one of the 'actors' suddenly drops something that falls off the virtual stage. My reaction was completely involuntary: I immediately reached out and tried to catch it! For a split second my brain was confused as to why it hadn't fallen into either of my hands. Wish I could have seen the look on my face when I realized what had happened. Absolutely brilliant.
This is a really beautiful and immersive film highlighting the bond between a mother and her daughter.
Incredible story and use of VR. You really feel the world in this one. So many times I wanted to reach out and interact with the world and characters. Stunning use of VR and storytelling!
Sure iwas touching, so if you like melodramatic stuff this is it. But even though the headtracking was smooth it didn't ad much to the experience.

Everyone who owns a VR device should be experiencing this story. One of the longer free experiences, and one of the best implementations of a story made-for-VR. Beautiful visuals and a moving story are a fantastic combination.
One of the best VR storytelling experiences out there.  Loved it!

review_title: Unique VR movie with disappointing story
one_reviews_text: Some scenes use VR with very unique ways and I really enjoyed it. But the ending is  disappointing too much in storywise and ruins the experience. Author really should change this ending .
Incredible story and use of VR. You really feel the world in this one. So many times I wanted to reach out and interact with the world and characters. Stunning use of VR and storytelling!
Sure iwas touching, so if you like melodramatic stuff this is it. But even though the headtracking was smooth it didn't ad much to the experience.

Everyone who owns a VR device should be experiencing this story. One of the longer free experiences, and one of the best implementations of a story made-for-VR. Beautiful visuals and a moving story are a fantastic combination.
One of the best VR storytelling experiences out there.  Loved it!

review_title: Unique VR movie with disappointing story
one_reviews_text: Some scenes use VR with very unique ways and I really enjoyed it. But the ending is  disappointing too much in storywise and ruins the experience. Author really should change this ending .
